subject: Mental Health
title: Anorexia and Control
description: Learn Anorexia and Control in one minute.

hook.text: When life feels chaotic, controlling food becomes the one thing that feels manageable.

buildup.text: Many people with anorexia describe restriction as giving them a sense of mastery and safety.

discovery.text: Perfectionism and anxiety often precede anorexia â€” the disorder channels existing traits.

twist.text: The illusion of control becomes its own prison â€” the disorder demands more and more.

climax.text: Recovery means learning to tolerate uncertainty without retreating to restriction.

punchline.text: Control was the promise. Loss of freedom was the price.

quiz.question: What psychological need does anorexia often fulfill?
options: A sense of control and mastery when life feels chaotic
